quest.name: A Visit to the Nu Mou
journal: Urianger is eager to press on with the hunt for the fae relics.
objectives: Head to the destination while under the effect of fae cloak.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: If it is indeed the Eulmoran Army, we may soon have to contend with Ran'jit again...which may prove problematic, even for you.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If only I hadn't been caught...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: With our enemies fast approaching, time is of the essence. We must needs accomplish our mission with all possible haste.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Of the two remaining bearers of the relics, the Nu Mou are the nearer. We shall seek them out next.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Among the fae folk, they bear the distinction of having abided in these lands since before the Flood. They are also the friendliest to men, and have served me faithfully whensoever I have called upon them. Indeed, they are the source of much of the knowledge I have acquired in my time here.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The path leadeth past my dwellings. Let us away.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Past yonder cliff lieth Pla Enni, home of the Nu Mou.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The others have gone ahead to scout the way. Come, let us follow.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: If the path striketh thee as precipitous, 'tis because it was once a mountain trail.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For where the lake now lieth, there was a valley, in whose midst thrived the city of Voeburt. 'Twas only when the Fuath came, in the wake of the Flood, that the settlement was drowned.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We stand now upon its former outskirts. Grazing lands where shepherds once tended their flocks.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though one cannot help but feel a pang of loss when faced with such a spectacle, one can scarcely blame the fae folk for so altering the land.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The blame for that lieth rightly with the Light─a force terrible enough to bring an entire civilization to its knees. An entire world. That it should have been allowed to rise up unchecked is the greater regret.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet, in spite of all the tragedy which surroundeth me, full glad am I for the chance to be here.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twas these hands which brought together the Warriors of Darkness and Minfilia, lest thou forget.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Therefore, even were there no Eighth Umbral Calamity to forestall, it seemeth only right that I strive to deliver the First from its doom.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Only right, I say, though such words ill convey the strength of my resolve.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: In truth, I can no more ignore the plight of this world than I can choose to stop breathing. And thus do I labor─for those we have lost. For those we can yet save.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The coming struggle promiseth to test us to our limits, but so long as we stand together, I doubt not but that we shall prevail.

dialogue.name: PIXIEA03313
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Pixie-)Aha! Mortals, just as we thought!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Hast thou business with us?

dialogue.name: PIXIEA03313
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Pixie-)Business? Ha! Nothing so boring! We smelled you coming, and thought we'd come to play!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: They do not appear to be pixies of Lydha Lran.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mine apologies, but we are in some haste. Mayhap another day.

dialogue.name: PIXIEA03313
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Pixie-)Ohhh, in some haste, are you? Then allow me to hasten you on your way! Tee hee hee!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Teleportation magick. For a mercy, we were not sent far from our course.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Should the pixies find us again, however, they will most assuredly repeat the trick.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We have not the time to waste. Let us avail ourselves of an enchantment I have learned.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: “Fae cloak,” 'tis called─a most ingenious magick which rendereth one invisible to fae folk, albeit briefly.

dialogue.name: PIXIEA03313
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Pixie-)Oh, no you don't! Back you go, tee hee hee!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I shall cast the enchantment upon thee. Under its aegis, thou art to make thy way past the pixies and rejoin our comrades.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Know, however, that the enchantment shall suffice to veil thee and thee alone. Be not tempted to employ a mount, as it will only serve to give thy presence away.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I shall cast the enchantment upon thee once more. The effect is quick to fade, so thou must needs be swift.

dialogue.name: PIXIEB03313
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Pixie-)Hee hee, found you! Aaand away you go!

dialogue.name: PIXIEC03313
dialogue.text: (-Earnest Pixie-)You've nothing to fear, mortal! I'm not like the other pixies.

dialogue.name: PIXIEC03313
dialogue.text: (-Earnest Pixie-)I'm WORSE! Ahahaha! Better luck next time!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The pixies leave, disappointment writ on their faces.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: We lost sight of you. Is everything all right?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I assumed you were right behind us. What took you so long?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I see... Yes, I'd say that's a valid excuse for lateness. You are hereby forgiven.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: In other good news, the Nu Mou village lies just through here. We'll enter as soon as Urianger deigns to join us.

dialogue.name: TYRNEE
dialogue.text: Ah! Ahhh! Mortals! Mortals are here! Lots of them!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I thought you said the Nu Mou were men's best friends. The poor thing was beside itself with fear.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Twas beside itself, perhaps...but not with fear.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: This is unacceptable! Unacceptable, I tell you! To have so many mortals appear at once...

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: It's more excitement than we can bear!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Greetings, Elder Wyd Aenc, Tyr Nee. It hath been a while.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Pray forgive my brevity, but time is against us. We are come to borrow the stone scepter of the Nu Mou.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Th-The stone scepter? Then...you mean to lift the seal over Lyhe Ghiah!?

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: That is unacceptable! Unacceptable, I tell you! If the king is set free, none here will be safe!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Unlike our fae cousins, we Nu Mou have called this land our home since time immemorial. Leaving is unthinkable.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Thus did full many of us lay down our lives to seal away our king when they were corrupted by light! If we do as you ask, our sacrifice would have been in vain!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Don't worry. We'll defeat Titania.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No one will come to harm.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Just hand over the godsdamned staff.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: But then you'll only become another Lightwarden! It changes nothing!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Easily said for one who hasn't experienced the king's wrath!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: S-Such discourtesy! It's unacceptable! Unacceptable, I tell you!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Honored Elder, pray believe me when I say that this womanman is possessed not only of the strength required to vanquish the king, but of something still more valuable: a means to resist the resultant corruption. Indeed, shehe hath already laid low the Lightwarden of Lakeland, all without succumbing to the influence of its light.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: SheHe is yet a stranger to this land, 'tis true, but shehe harboreth the selfsame desire to see the sin eaters eliminated as we do.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Wilt thou not lend us thy hand, that we might see thy beloved home restored to its former glory?

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Hmmm... You have always done right by us, Urianger. If you have placed your faith in this womanman, then so shall we.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: As you say, we want nothing more than to be rid of the sin eaters.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, this is not a decision to be made lightly. We require time to deliberate. A turn of the moon, perhaps...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We don't have a turn of the moon. Unless we want to debate this with the Eulmoran Army.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Elder...given all that is at stake, I cannot well expect thee simply to roll over, and acquiesce to our request.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: But even now, a powerful foe draweth near, and I fear I must beseech thee to hasten thy deliberations, that thou mightst fetch us the scepter while there is yet time to use it.

dialogue.name: TYRNEE
dialogue.text: R-Roll over!? F-Fetch!? Ahhh! Ahhhhhh!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: You know full well that naught gives us greater pleasure than to render aid to men!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: You know full well, yet you speak the words of power regardless? It's unfair! Unfair, I tell you!

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: <sigh> In happier times, it was our honor to assist mortals in need and receive rewards befitting our deeds.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Since the Kingdom of Voeburt fell, however, we've been starved of man's patronage. After so many years of deprivation, it is...difficult to ignore such an earnest entreaty.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: Very well, Urianger. I promise to give you as swift an answer as I may.

dialogue.name: WYDAENC
dialogue.text: In return, I ask that you and yours remain here the while, and bestow upon us your patronage. Is this arrangement agreeable?
